Can be noisy till around 11pm with horns rooting and dogs barking but after that it settles. Definitely worth the money.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Howard1947
Detailed Review: Our 1st 2 nights in India were spent at Colonel’s Retreat. This is an excellent B + B in New Delhi The owners and staff are lovely people only wanting to please their guests. We had dinner 2 nights both of which were simple but excellent full of flavour and beautifully presented. Breakfast was also very good and the rooms very comfortable. Thank you

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Richieread212
Detailed Review: I must say what a wonderful and welcoming place this was to stay. We were made to feel very much at home, and the food we were served was some of the best we ate during our stay in India. Much recommend place to stay!!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: johnastone
Detailed Review: We stayed for two nights at this boutique hotel, the rooms are very nice with a communal area on each floor. The service was excellent and the food served on the rooftop restaurant was very good and all  home cooked. The owners were there in the  evening to ensure our stay was all we expected it to be. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: ChrisandGary2020
Detailed Review: Stayed here 2 nights when we arrived in New Delhi. Very friendly and comfortable and in a lovely quiet area. Bedroom a little "tired" but very clean with everything you need. There is also a lift if the stairs are a bit much! Staff are very helpful and attentive and the rooftop dining area very attractive with views over the city. The food here was fabulous and the owner took the time to explain what each dish was and where it originated from. Would recommend this place. We booked this place through an agent as part of a package so not sure on details of individual costings.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Peter Phillips
Review: Perfect start to our India Tour
Detailed Review: A lovely boutique hotel set in a residential area.  Spacious clean room with use of a comfortable communal lounge area.  What makes this accommodation stand out from the rest is undoubtedly the amazing home-cooked food, friendliness of staff and their attentiveness.  This truly was a perfect start to our India tour.  Many thanks Colonel Retreat, we would love to visit again one day!

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Easibury
Detailed Review: A lovely hotel, friendly people, and a genuinely welcoming approach. Arrived mid morning after a long flight and the amazing culture shock of Delhi traffic on the drive from the airport. A pot of tea and banana bread was soon offered and we began our three night stay knowing that we would be looked after. The breakfasts and dinner were excellent, afternoon tea and cake a delightful treat after  a hard day's tourism!  The owner and his wife were often present and their knowledgeable chats about the hotel, India and its history were really informative. Everyone at the hotel deserves a pat on the back for the quality of service and warm welcomes.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jspen
Detailed Review: Such a chilled place to return to after a busy day within Delhi. We ate on the roof twice and both meals where excellent. You would always find a member of staff about with a waiting smile.   Another mention is that the manager organised a driver to Agra for the day, we didn't bother with a tour guide as we wanted to see the Taj and Fort Agra at our own pace!. This cost 7500 which when compared to a tour trip for 2 elsewhere is very cheap.  Overall a lovely stay, would happily recommend it to anyone who's looking at staying in South Delhi.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Edward M
Detailed Review: We were delivered straight off the plane to this retreat and it was perfect. Excellent service, large comfy rooms, a surprise dinner on the rooftop (both nights), convenient location for launching into Delhi and more.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ann King
Detailed Review: We arrived in Delhi after a long flight from the UK. This hotel is a true retreat. Situated in a very quiet part of Delhi we immediately felt able to acclimatise gently. Our room was very clean with a great shower and very comfy bed. We decided to eat in during our stay and we were not let down at all. Sitting up on the terrace -even in February was delightful. There were outdoor heaters and lovely rugs to use too. The menu was small but everything was home cooked and delicious. We would hesitate to stay in this hotel. Thoroughly recommendable, a real refuge from manic Delhi!!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Umsh
Detailed Review: It was a pleasant stay at the hotel.. staff was good and well mannered. Service was also good. Hv arranged transfer as well. Cleanliness was also there in the hotel, location wise is better.   Over all happy.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michiel L
Review: Pleasant and well maintained hotel with great service.
Detailed Review: Hotel Ajanta surprised me in a pleasant way.  The hotel is located in a very busy somewhat chaotic area with narrow streets end a lot of local business. But as soon as you step into the hotel you find yourself in a well maintained and organized spot.  The building itself breathes a colonial atmosphere: corridors with beautiful and clean tiles. The rooms are decorated with cool pictures of old colonial Indian buildings.  The staff is very helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean and diverse. Some of our group had really luxury rooms with a very modern bathroom, airconditioning, fan, fridge, a reasonably priced minibar. Others had a more basic room.  The hotel features a really good restaurant which serves delicious dinners, and a nice continental / Indian breakfast buffet in the…

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Dany M
Detailed Review: Beautiful hotel, and very comfortable room. Good restaurant, tasty breakfast buffet, and good menu. Staff smiling and helpful. Special mention to our driver Sakhi Chand for the visit of New Delhi. I recommend this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Linda M
Detailed Review: The Ajanta is in a great location if you like to be close to the hustle and bustle. Yes, it’s in a noisy location and you might prefer a quieter location if you find it difficult to sleep with all that activity going on outside. We’ve stayed here four times over the last three years. The rooms are clean and spacious and have had a bit of a makeover since we were last here. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel has a great atmosphere. We love it!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Julia S
Detailed Review: Staff was very helpful to help us organize our travel and the communication with Maya and Rashid was very effective. Tasty buffet with a variety of Indian and Western options.  Nice big and clean rooms.  I highly recommend this hotel.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Avijit Das
Detailed Review: We book a deluxe triple room with free airport pickup from Booking.com at a reasonable price and our check-in experience was very good, we got a room at first floor of the hotel with nice and clean room, I personally recommend the hotel for family stay and if I stay at the hotel in feature  I will prefer room with Windows.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: DD tr
Detailed Review: I stay in Delhi on a regular basis and have recently started using hotel Ajenta and I have not been disappointed with my decision. The reception staff are professional yet warm and welcoming, the office staff are ready to help with any questions or travel plans and the room staff are lovely. Anyone who is unsure about where to stay in Delhi this hotel is a must.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Joeri B
Review: A great place for a great price but prepare to loose sleep
Detailed Review: Price-wise this place is a great place to be. The food in the restaurant is cheap, its close by several tourist locations in Delhi and its a safe neighborhood. The manager is nice and the staff is friendly. They all speak decent English. On departure day our group was given a room free of charge to freshen up and rest some in preparation for the flight home. Normally, hotels charge extra for this so this was really nice of them and deserves praise.  On the other hand the hotel has some (minor) problems. The size of the restaurant is too small. During busy times (at breakfast) people will have to be seated in the hallway or stand.  Some of the rooms are under par, the hotel seems to be undergoing reservations and not all rooms have been renovated yet. It looks like they started…

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: aGs1308
Detailed Review: So, having read the reviews for the Ajanta and how lovely it was I was disappointed on arrival firstly by the location and second by the rooms. The hotel is on a very busy side street with what seemed to be another 100 hotels, fruit sellers, side stalls and general hustle & bustle. Our room had no window which, in some respects, we a blessing as it was quiet and dark. The bedding was smelly & dirty though which is one of the main reasons for the poor score. Breakfast was ok with a reasonable choice. We chose to cancel our other Delhi stop over stay at the Ajanta.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Prasad B
Detailed Review: great services staff and room are nice zahoor helped me to contact my friend and with other arrangements ...recommended to everyone I have been here since many years and had no problem at all.breakfast served here is well cooked and very reasonable as well as compare to other hotels location is centrally located near new delhitrain station. ...

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: temscholten
Review: We have been many times in this hotel
Detailed Review: Like the other times we have been in this hotel, again this hotel help us a great we have diffculities with our flight back to holland and rashid and zahoor helped us very well they took all the time, they also have great inhouse travel agency with different tour packages for agra jaipur also rajasthan. The rooms are beautiful the whole staff is excellent ..

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: M N Shah
Review: Location was very crowded and not clean. Hotel room was smelly too.
Detailed Review: Overall room was decent enough. It was spacious enough too. The room was clean enough. The bed was small for my height. And bed was smelly too. There is no proper window. Bathroom was spacious enough and there was not a major issue with it. There was a common boiler and not a geyser in every room. Linen was not that clean enough. Overall I would say it was not up to the mark as per what is charged to a traveller. Staff could improve a bit. Whenever a traveler check in is done, your staff should know that you have to send water and towels. But I need to ask for the same for the first time. So that could improve a little bit.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rrraja
Detailed Review: I got this hotel in tripadvisor when I was in Bangladesh.Then I booked the hotel and stay 4 nights there.Room was clean as I had seen there website.They are very Helpful .They help us to go to Ajmer and Jaipur.Milan gudied us very well.I love this Place.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bbbnnn
Detailed Review: Room and staff are nice.They are very helpful.We enjoy our stay there.They have a open place in The top floor where we spend our time in the night.We will come again to this place.One Bengali man in the reception helped us a lot.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: murshid
Detailed Review: I styed  there  with my family for five nights.The room was clean and the staff was very helpful.Though the area is not good but hotel people are very nice.We enjoy  our stay with Amax.I will come again to Amax for their politeness.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: M N Shah
Review: Location was very crowded and not clean. Hotel room was smelly too.
Detailed Review: Overall room was decent enough. It was spacious enough too. The room was clean enough. The bed was small for my height. And bed was smelly too. There is no proper window. Bathroom was spacious enough and there was not a major issue with it. There was a common boiler and not a geyser in every room. Linen was not that clean enough. Overall I would say it was not up to the mark as per what is charged to a traveller. Staff could improve a bit. Whenever a traveler check in is done, your staff should know that you have to send water and towels. But I need to ask for the same for the first time. So that could improve a little bit.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Rrraja
Detailed Review: I got this hotel in tripadvisor when I was in Bangladesh.Then I booked the hotel and stay 4 nights there.Room was clean as I had seen there website.They are very Helpful .They help us to go to Ajmer and Jaipur.Milan gudied us very well.I love this Place.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Bbbnnn
Detailed Review: Room and staff are nice.They are very helpful.We enjoy our stay there.They have a open place in The top floor where we spend our time in the night.We will come again to this place.One Bengali man in the reception helped us a lot.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: murshid
Detailed Review: I styed  there  with my family for five nights.The room was clean and the staff was very helpful.Though the area is not good but hotel people are very nice.We enjoy  our stay with Amax.I will come again to Amax for their politeness.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: mophead88
Detailed Review: Clean, comfortable and friendly staff. Laundry is fairly priced, breakfast is cheap and delicious! Good social vibe. It's worth noting for the noise sensitive among you that due to lots of hard concrete surfaces, music/conversations travel from the common/staff areas and hallway into the bedrooms at night; other than this factor (which won't bother most people), highly recommend.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Angel V
Review: Nice, good vibes, clean hostel in Delhi
Detailed Review: I have stayed at a few hostels in Delhi, from the hectic paharganj to one in south east Delhi, but this is the first hostel that is not dirty.  Stayed in 8 mix dorm and also the guests seem more respectful than other places. It is easier to meet more people in the common areas as well.  The rooftop is pretty nice and overlooks an open area where locals gather and normally you see people playing games. The common area at the reception is pretty nice as well. The guys working here are super nice and have helped me with whatever I've asked them. I was here mid february and the place is a bit cold and the hot shower has been hit or miss situation. The location can be seen from both views: 1. To get to/from nearest metro station is far and could be challenging and overwhelming to walk there the first time through those passages, but once you know your way, it is a good 15min walk but 2. It is a bit away from the chaotic city that Delhi could be.  My intention was to stay only one night here because i need to be in a different part of the city, but i changed my mind and stayed here 1 week despite my one hour commute each way to where I need to go every morning and night. The hostel feels good.  As summary, absolutely recommend Jugaads hostel…

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Will
Review: Convenient and great value for money!
Detailed Review: We stayed here for our last night in India. The staff were all super friendly for everything we needed. You can order dinner at the hostel which is great if you feel like having a chill evening. We got the breakfast too and it was delicious!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: mophead88
Detailed Review: Clean, comfortable and friendly staff. Laundry is fairly priced, breakfast is cheap and delicious! Good social vibe. It's worth noting for the noise sensitive among you that due to lots of hard concrete surfaces, music/conversations travel from the common/staff areas and hallway into the bedrooms at night; other than this factor (which won't bother most people), highly recommend.

It's worth noting for the noise sensitive among you that due to lots of hard concrete surfaces, music/conversations travel from the common/staff areas and hallway into the bedrooms at night; other than this factor (which won't bother most people), highly recommend.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Angel V
Review: Nice, good vibes, clean hostel in Delhi
Detailed Review: I have stayed at a few hostels in Delhi, from the hectic paharganj to one in south east Delhi, but this is the first hostel that is not dirty.  Stayed in 8 mix dorm and also the guests seem more respectful than other places. It is easier to meet more people in the common areas as well.  The rooftop is pretty nice and overlooks an open area where locals gather and normally you see people playing games. The common area at the reception is pretty nice as well. The guys working here are super nice and have helped me with whatever I've asked them. I was here mid february and the place is a bit cold and the hot shower has been hit or miss situation. The location can be seen from both views: 1. To get to/from nearest metro station is far and could be challenging and overwhelming to walk there the first time through those passages, but once you know your way, it is a good 15min walk but 2. It is a bit away from the chaotic city that Delhi could be.  My intention was to stay only one night here because i need to be in a different part of the city, but i changed my mind and stayed here 1 week despite my one hour commute each way to where I need to go every morning and night. The hostel feels good.  As summary, absolutely recommend Jugaads hostel…

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Will
Review: Convenient and great value for money!
Detailed Review: We stayed here for our last night in India. The staff were all super friendly for everything we needed. You can order dinner at the hostel which is great if you feel like having a chill evening. We got the breakfast too and it was delicious!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Lolipik
Detailed Review: Just arriving in Delhi Ali help us to have a simcard, change money and offer you a excellent service for your futurs steps.  All Ah good price !   The room is perfect, clean and confortable !  Just Thank you

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Frans R
Detailed Review: If you plan to visit Delhi, go to SMYLE inn first.  The staff and ALI are very helpful if you have any question.  They have a lot of customer’s services at the real price !  Situation in the city is perfect to visit Delhi. They can plan for you all your trip, just a part or just give you free excellent information.  Change money at good price ! / SIM card at normal price ! / city map with advise / room / ... all is perfect there.  Thanks a lot.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Pupi
Detailed Review: All of the staff is friendly and helpful ! ALI at the 3th floor can help you to book or organise all / a  part of your trip IF YOU WANT. No obligation, just for information, juste for SMYLE :-).  SIM card / taxi / tuktuk / city map / booking / ... all you need in Delhi is there !  Definitely the best

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: chico1950
Detailed Review: This was our first visit to India and this was the first place that we stayed in. So welcoming and friendly, they couldn’t do enough for us. Although we were not full board we did have dinner 2 out of 3 nights and the Food was excellent. Breakfast was a delight and a great introduction to Indian food. The rooms were nice and the restaurant had a homely feel.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Daisy_from_Oz
Review: An oasis amongst the chaos of Delhi
Detailed Review: Arrived in the early hours of the morning into Delhi and checked into the comfort of the Colonel's Retreat.  Great little hotel, located in a quiet neighbourhood with comfortable amenities and wonderful staff.  They served a lovely breakfast with the most delicious banana bread I have ever tasted.  Rooms are not sound-proof and the morning activities in the kitchen/dining area were heard in our room, as well as the lift operation which was adjacent to our room.  The size and layout of the room differed to the photos we saw and we did find it a little cramped.  The common areas were very nice but we would have liked more space in the privacy of our room.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: nyalta
Detailed Review: Such a welcoming guesthouse with a great roof terrace although still a bit chilly in mid January for roof top dining in the evening.  All staff were very friendly and helpful and the food was excellent.  Banana bread is delicious and the home cooked dishes were full of flavour.  Hearty breakfast set us up well for our day’s sightseeing.  The situation, away from the traffic and hustle and bustle of the city, coupled with comfortable beds, meant we slept well and felt refreshed in the morning. We had a great stay at the start of our tour of India.

Source.Name: Colonels Retreat_Delhi2.csv
Name: Isobel G
Detailed Review: This is a great place to escape the noise and chaos of Delhi. The staff were really friendly and helpful, the food was very good including g home made bread, preserves and banana bread, our room was really spacious, comfortable and very clean. There’s a lovely roof terrace too. Thank you for looking after us so well, Isobel and Andrew

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Michael Prasad
Detailed Review: The staff were extremely friendly. Hotel Agenta is not a 5 star hotel however I was treated like a 5 star client, which makes a huge difference when you are on a budget !!! I highly recommend this place if you traveling on a budget.   Clean, Confortable and Safe with lots of hot water. I'll definitely stay here again and I highly recommend Hotel Agenta to any travellers on a budget.  Fantastic experience :-)

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Maria Alejandra A
Detailed Review: The hotel was great, we have a wonderful time there. The staff was so nice, specially Mr. Rashid, who helped us with everything, and made our stay there so comfortable. He is the best! We will definitely stay every time we come to Delhi at Ajanta.  Many thanks

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jonas G
Detailed Review: Nice staff here. The in-house travel desk was helpful too (Zahoor & Rashid) and I booked a driver through them who was an absolute delight to spend time with. His name is Sakjichand. A beautiful soul. You can probably request him if you need a driver!

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: sdas_32
Detailed Review: Booked Hotel Ajanta at Paharganj for 2 nights stay on personal trip in advance and overall experience is satisfied. Though it's not first time but have notice not much change. Hotel staff/s are cordial The room was comfortable but breakfast calls for improvement.  Nonetheless, to mention that all departments should have better co-ordination among themselves.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Ryan Truong
Detailed Review: Location wise is really good as it stays right in the heart of Delhi and in a walking distance to metro station. They also offer exchange money service here at good price so if you plan to stay here, no need to exchange your money at the airport (the rate is terrible). Staff is professtional. Breakfast is good. The only thing trouble is the wifi, it is not steady. But it seems like the wifi here in India is not good in general.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: CFA PRATIK P
Review: Feedback on staying at Hotel Ajanta
Detailed Review: I had booked Hotel Ajanta at Paharganj for having stay on 10-13, 16-17 and 21-22 of Jan 2020. I must admit that i am satisfy with Hotel staff and Receptionist (Miss Gunjan and others). The rooms are comfortable with all amenities and breakfast were good with Indian-western style. Even the cab drivers provided to us were good.  The most important was they provide us a room for two times after checkout for refreshment. I would really like to visit again and will recommended to all tourist to at least give here a try for your stay.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Aamir s
Detailed Review: On behalf of Varanasi Excursion i have sent lots of guest to ajanta. All went fantastic service is very helpful and friendly ambience of the hotel is amazing rooms are very much likable and good. Thanks for all team.

Source.Name: Hotel_Ajantay_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jenna
Review: Comfortable, friendly service and great location
Detailed Review: My friend and I were visiting from Australia and had a great stay at Ajanta. The room was clean and comfortable and the service was great. Rashid helped us book transport and train tickets to Amritsar which was extremely helpful. The lady at the front desk was also very kind and helpful however I didn't catch her name. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Delhi. Thanks to all staff at Ajanta.

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jiii
Detailed Review: Request mostly accepted. staff are friendly. rooms are cozy and it was a great time. there was a water problem once but after one day fully fixed. my friends all enjoyed. I used tempo rental service for one day agra tour. great

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Berkeley_MS
Review: Depressing and very different from Lonely Plant's review
Detailed Review: Clean and fair, but that's about it. The area is not good, the hotel is depressing (windows at best to a brick wall), the linen is old and grey and the hot water not in ample supply. Rooftop restaurant is a few tables on a level sunk below higher roofs with water boilers, laundry and the like. Was not very cheap either (4200 rupees, ca. USD60)

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Jiii
Detailed Review: Request mostly accepted. staff are friendly. rooms are cozy and it was a great time. there was a water problem once but after one day fully fixed. my friends all enjoyed. I used tempo rental service for one day agra tour. great

Source.Name: Hotel_Amax_Inn_Delhi2.csv

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: shania.twang
Detailed Review: the room was kind if cold and damp. the washroom was nasty. the person who checked me in was sweet but then the next day someone working there offered to give me a walking tour and it was whack. wanted to walk through a very crowded area for 45 mins to get to a spice market. had zero background on the monuments we went to. and then discouraged me to go to red fort because he was lazy. lol bad experience so i left.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Constance Louise
Detailed Review: Myself and friends stayed at Jugaad for 2 weeks and we had a really really great time! The food was all really good although moderately expensive. The host and staff were all super friendly and the atmosphere was really cool and social. They had all the information and resources you could need for your stay. A little out of the way from the city centre was quite nice to come back to after a big tourist day. Only let down were the prices but the host had a lot of useful information and recommendations. But otherwise highly recommend!

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: shania.twang
Detailed Review: the room was kind if cold and damp. the washroom was nasty. the person who checked me in was sweet but then the next day someone working there offered to give me a walking tour and it was whack. wanted to walk through a very crowded area for 45 mins to get to a spice market. had zero background on the monuments we went to. and then discouraged me to go to red fort because he was lazy. lol bad experience so i left.

Detailed Review: the room was kind if cold and damp. the washroom was nasty. the person who checked me in was sweet but then the next day someone working there offered to give me a walking tour and it was whack. wanted to walk through a very crowded area for 45 mins to get to a spice market. had zero background on the monuments we went to. and then discouraged me to go to red fort because he was lazy. lol bad experience so i left.

Source.Name: Jugaad_hostel_Delhi2.csv
Name: Constance Louise
Detailed Review: Myself and friends stayed at Jugaad for 2 weeks and we had a really really great time! The food was all really good although moderately expensive. The host and staff were all super friendly and the atmosphere was really cool and social. They had all the information and resources you could need for your stay. A little out of the way from the city centre was quite nice to come back to after a big tourist day. Only let down were the prices but the host had a lot of useful information and recommendations. But otherwise highly recommend!

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Alexandra
Detailed Review: My brother and I stayed here for three nights. You get what you pay for here. Cold room during the month of January. A little bit noisy. Walking distance to the New Delhi train station. Set us up with a great driver for the day.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Florian
Review: Perfectly located hostel with awesome staff
Detailed Review: The hostel is located right next to the main bazaar, but still relatively quiet. The rooms are simple but perfectly fine for the price. The roof terrace is nice. The staff is extraordinary, assisting us with getting Sim cards and booking busses. Also many thanks to Deepak who helped us a lot.

Source.Name: Smyle Inn_Delhi2.csv
Name: Manu N
Detailed Review: We spent 5 nights there and we coudn't be more comfortable.location is great and  room was really clean and we had  huge bed. Specially thanks to Alam who was super helpful and take care of us and made us feel in our second home.
